lexUnit.name: intimidating.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: frightening, bringing about fear and awe

sentence.text: Even this was no pushover as he laybacked up towards a line of large intimidating roofs .
Go to any demonstration worthy of the name these days , and you are swamped by offers to buy from an intimidating array of news sheets , statements or appeals published by informal associations .

More frequently they try to manipulate the media to their advantage by the selective release of carefully timed and adjusted information and by threatening , punishing , and intimidating media staff .
He 's a very intimidating fellow .

On the other hand , his determination to win became such that he frequently appeared to condone his fast men bowling in an intimidating fashion , which obviously led to criticism from press and public .
It was not long -- and far quicker than he knew -- before she became aware of his scrutiny and soon after sensed the unusual and possibly intimidating intensity of it .
Maggie had thought there might be a sign of deference in the fat girl 's voice when she replied to the somewhat intimidating supervisor , but there was n't .
He shows his annoyance with some intimidating facial expression , backed up by a sparse selection of adjectival punctuation invariably using the ` f " word , which he uses with considerable effect .
The single rough road across Simonswood Moss near Liverpool is barred at either end by the intimidating iron gates of the Knowsley estate .
The parents were able to eliminate the intimidating outbursts almost entirely .

Despite the fact that he has been involved in more intimidating tackles than most professionals of his generation , he thinks a line has to be drawn between hard edged professionalism and pathological violence .
She was tall and beautifully groomed with iron-grey hair , a smooth , high-cheekboned face and a most intimidating manner .
In her publicity photographs she could , he recalled , look beautiful in a somewhat intimidating , intellectual and very English mould .
They 're not used to this intimidating energy , the volume , Bono 's mobile passion .
He had a tremendous presence , an aura of invincibility that was both intimidating and impressive .
My natural instinct once I reached the rather intimidating environment of London was to seek out other lesbians .
You may say he has an intimidating record .
Adult males are very intimidating animals .
The tour to New Zealand is an intimidating affair by any criteria , with Canterbury , Auckland and the All Blacks on successive Saturdays .
Existing fitness centres can be intimidating places with not so much as an ounce of unwanted fat on display .
The cloud-covered Amazon , the ochre tones of the Altiplano , whose intimidating monotony is broken only by the blue of the great lake -- mountains and more mountains .
The vast roof split by the crack line of Sloth looked fierce , so we sneaked past it in search of less intimidating fare .
She is smaller and less intimidating than I had imagined her .
It 'd be good if the home crowd could sing a bit , if only to keep alive the myth that Leeds create an intimidating atmosphere .
Even when dozing , there was no relaxation in her husband 's ruthlessly hard , stern features -- no apparent softening of his intimidating and menacing personality .
Government officials accused the rebels of intimidating voters .
